title: The All-New Norco Search Gravel Bike
content:
BC-based Norco might be best known for its Optic high pivot mountain bike, but the brand has long had a vested interest in gravel bikes, too. Today, they launched the all-new Search, available as a flat bar ripper ($999 complete) and two drop bar build models with some clever detailing. Let’s check them out below…

“With updated modern gravel geo, the new Search is fast, light, and responsive on gravel, while staying stable at speed and confident through rough terrain.

Norco Search Quick Hits

  • Five sizes – 1, 2, 3, 4, 5
  • Flat Bar build $999
  • Frame $1849
  • Complete builds ranging from $3399 to $9499
  • Lightweight rigid gravel frame
  • Updated modern geo
  • Downtube storage on Carbon models
  • Additional adventure mounts on Alloy version (coming later this year)
  • 45 mm stock tires with proprietary front fender,
  • 700 x 50 mm max tire clearance on all sizes
  • Three 2025 build kits

Norco Search Geometry

The all-new Search features a new-school gravel geo fit for a fast, lively, and robust ride quality whether ripping doubletrack or in a paceline on hardpack roads. With a taller headtube, slacker head angle, and longer reach, it’s more stable on rough terrain and ready to tackle steeper grades with ease. A constant 69.5º head angle and a variable seat tube angle ensure similar ride quality across all frame sizes and 80 mm of trail place it firmly in the high trail category.

Frame Details

The updated, longer fork adds stability, and the new geometry is compatible with suspension forks if you want to add some extra cushion. The frame is UDH compatible and supports fitments for all the latest wide-range 1x drivetrain technologies. There’s an integrated tool storage door on the downtube and an integrated fender.

Fully guided cable routing and a fully threaded BSA bottom bracket make maintenance a breeze.

Search Party

Currently, there are three build kits, ranging from SRAM Red XPLR at $9499 to Apex XPLR at $3399 and a flat bar at $999.

Roll on over to Norco to see the complete lineup!
